channel.title: UBI public release candidate 1
channel.description:
[center][img]http://www.impsoft.net/forums/image.php?u=4&dateline=1150199914[/img] IMPSoft Brings you: UBI (Universal Bot Interface) Public Beta 1[/center]
UBI makes multible botting once again avalible. Works with scar scripts. Dosn't use windows mouse or keyboard. Implements all window, focus, mouse,and key events.
Mirrors: [url=http://www.filefactory.com/?10c713]http://www.filefactory.com/?10c713[/url] [url=http://www.impsoft.net/public/]http://www.impsoft.net/public/[/url] [url=http://www.360bbaction.com/]http://www.360bbaction.com/[/url] [url=http://cruels.net/downloads/UBIRC1.rar]http://cruels.net/downloads/UBIRC1.rar[/url]
Video: [url=http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-2349994590662633680&q=impsoft]http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-2349994590662633680&q=impsoft[/url]
What is a IMP? [img]http://img528.imageshack.us/img528/9471/imposftuser0dc.png[/img]

item.title: UBI public release candidate 1
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Attached is the result of the diff command.
Also attached are the files they have changed/deleted.

Note: I think I have a different version of rt.jar - it dosn’t matter you get the idea of whats changed.

Applet.jad overwrites UBI/java/applet/Applet.jad
The rest go into UBI/java/awt/

Note: these files are hot off the decompiler and as such still have the jad extension, change it. They will then need to be compiled and put into your copy of rt.jar - Don’t ask, if you don’t know your not competent enough to do it.

By the way… a4cb800 is two days in milisecs

I’ve got to say: Crude but very nice. Good Job ruler and co. !!

Read full topic

Look good so far, fixing the bugs and making it functional to its true potential will be the most difficult part I’m sure. Good luck.

item.title: UBI public release candidate 1
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

Krichevskoy:

Interesting, an entire replacement runtime library. What’s been tweaked?

custom event queues, event managment, threads looking for orders from scar. files are used to communicate from scar to each java runtime and client. Each client has its own queue.

Their is someone working on moving the applet off screen and overwriting the scar image search functions to work with it. We actually have a paritially working copy. And have witness both ubi and it working together for a short time. still has bugs

Read full topic
